document.docAuthor: Akbar, Shahid Ali, Bharti, Himender, Kanturski, Mariusz & Wachkoo, Aijaz Ahmad
document.docTitle: Syllophopsis peetersi Akbar & Bharti & Kanturski & Wachkoo 2021, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: First record of the myrmicine ant genus Syllophopsis Santschi, 1915 (Hymenoptera Formicidae) from India with description of a new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: First record of the myrmicine ant genus Syllophopsis Santschi, 1915 (Hymenoptera Formicidae) from India with description of a new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Types.
Holotype worker: India , Kerala , Silent Valley National Park , 11.0939N , 76.4462E , Kerala , India ,
900 m
.
a.s.l.,
25.ix.2011
, Winkler extraction method, leg. S.A. Akbar (unique specimen identifier PUAC5001 )
.
Paratypes : 6 workers with same data as holotype ( PUAC5002 – PUAC5007 )
. Additional material examined:
14 workers , Silent Valley National park near Badriya Juma Masjid , Mukkali , 11.0618N , 76.5390E , Kerala , India ,
700 m
.a.s.l., 20.xii.2016 , Winkler extraction method;
8 workers ( PSAA0001 – PSAA0008 )
;
2 workers (PSAA0009–PSAA0010 for molecular analysis, NMNH )
;
2 workers (PSAA00011–PSAA0012 for SEM studies, USKP )
;
2 workers , same data except:
21.xii.2016
(PSAA00013–PSAA0014 NHMUK ), leg. S.A. Akbar.
Color yellowish to very light brown.

The majority of the species in the genus have been collected via Winkler sampling, inhabiting leaf litter from the tropical rainforests (AntWeb 2021), and same holds true for the new species described here. The species appears rare, with a restricted distribution. However, it is quite possible that the species occurs elsewhere in southern India and Sri Lanka , in areas with similar habitat.

Etymolog y. The species epithet honours the late Professor Christian Peeters and is a masculine genitive noun. The name ‘Peeters’ is derived from the Greek root word Petrus (‘rock’ or ‘stone’) which also appropriately symbolises the foundational stature of Prof. Christian Peeters’ work in the study of ants.
